intro: Muniria angustisepala, commonly known as the narrow-lobed muniria, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and hairy foliage. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, typically blooming during the dry season. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate in shape, with a pointed tip and serrated edges. Muniria angustisepala is often found in open grasslands and along riverbanks, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
